title: Werner Kok
text:
Werner Kok (born 17 January 1993) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, currently playing with the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">South African Sevens</a> team. His regular position is centre or winger.
He was a member of the South African Sevens team that won a bronze medal at the <a href="Rugby%20sevens%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a>.
Rugby career.
Youth.
At high school level, Kok represented the Pumas at the Under-16 2009 Grant Khomo Week and also at the Under-18 <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> tournament in 2011, where he scored a try in their match against Boland.
In 2012, he moved to <a href="Cape%20Town">Cape Town</a>, where he represented the side during the <a href="2012%20Under-19%20Provincial%20Championship">2012 Under-19 Provincial Championship</a>. He made eleven appearances for them in the competition. He scored one try during the regular season – their second-last match against – and scored a second try for the side in the final against the to help them to a 22–18 victory to see them win the championship.
South African Sevens.
In 2013, Kok became involved with the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">South African Sevens</a> side. He made his debut for them at the <a href="2013%20London%20Sevens">2013 London Sevens</a>, the final event of the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20IRB%20Sevens%20World%20Series">2012–13 IRB Sevens World Series</a>. He didn't play in the <a href="2013%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20Sevens">2013 Rugby World Cup Sevens</a> in June 2013, but he did represent South Africa at the <a href="2013%20World%20Games">2013 World Games</a> in <a href="Cali">Cali</a>, <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>, where South Africa won the event, beating <a href="Argentina%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Argentina</a> in the final.
He established himself as a regular for South Africa during the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20IRB%20Sevens%20World%20Series">2013–14 IRB Sevens World Series</a>, including their wins at the <a href="2013%20South%20Africa%20Sevens">2013 South Africa Sevens</a> and the <a href="2014%20USA%20Sevens">2014 USA Sevens</a>. He was also included in their squad that played at the <a href="2014%20Commonwealth%20Games">2014 Commonwealth Games</a> in <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>, helping his side all the way to the final, where they got a 17–12 victory over a <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">New Zealand</a> that won the previous four tournaments.
Kok was named the World Rugby Sevens Player of the Year for 2015 following his performances in the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20IRB%20Sevens%20World%20Series">2014–15 IRB Sevens World Series</a>, where he was also the leading tackler in the series.
2016 Summer Olympics.
Kok was included in a 12-man squad for the <a href="Rugby%20sevens%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>. He was named as a substitute for their first match in Group B of the competition against <a href="Spain%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Spain</a>, with South Africa winning the match 24–0.
